question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will be marked as **No**. This question is open to additional candidates that may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Asa Hutchinson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently under consideration; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Donald Trump Jr. and Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates or combinations will resolve as **No**. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump Jr. nor Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Donald Trump Jr. nor Asa Hutchinson are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any candidate or combination that includes either Donald Trump Jr. or Asa Hutchinson will resolve as **No**. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Are both Asa Hutchinson and Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Asa Hutchinson and Donald Trump Jr. are chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates or combinations will result in a **No**. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined solely by the selections made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

Resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a definitive declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will automatically apply to this market. Trustworthy users are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (2) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Joe Biden will declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (2) there will be an increase in Kamala Harris's chances of winning over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, either Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement stating that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's chances of winning rise in the upcoming week according to Nate Silver's model?

This will be considered YES if the probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will resolve as NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative accounts, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates introduced later on.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this part resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will resolve as "No". This part may consider new candidates added in the future.

The question will resolve as "No" if either of these conditions is not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this part resolves positively.

(b) Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will resolve as "Yes". This part may consider new candidates added in the future.

The question will resolve as "No" if either of these conditions is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, this part resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will resolve as "No". This part may include new candidates introduced in the future.

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if either of these criteria is not met.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official statement regarding Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO otherwise. Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not impact the resolution as long as he remains President.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if either of the following occurs: (a) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO otherwise. Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not impact the resolution as long as he does not remain President.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away before Saturday and continue being President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This will be resolved as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden stays in office as US President until the end of July 2024 (ET). It will be resolved as NO in all other scenarios. Note: A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution as long as he is still President.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state's primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. 

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from any U.S. state's primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is not met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

The question will resolve as "Yes" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Ted Cruz be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

2. Ted Cruz is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 U.S. election.

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or become unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Kamala Harris assumes the role of President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Biden withdraws from the election prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This requirement will be fulfilled if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, or a general agreement among reliable news reports.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating efforts to express their opposition to their party's plan to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination earlier than initially intended, arguing that it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“This is a very poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and somehow force unity, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 lawmaker signatures, that would also suffice to resolve this market as YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators indicating this before midnight July 20 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early AND will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures.

2. 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, as confirmed by the New York Times source.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves to YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early OR will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators not call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
This question resolves to YES if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is not signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures.

2. Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators do not call for Biden to drop out at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, as confirmed by the New York Times source.

If at least one of the conditions is met, the question resolves to YES. If both conditions are met, the question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden early AND will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. A public statement against the early nomination proposal is endorsed by at least 20 Members of the House or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party prior to the conclusion of Sunday, July 21st. This can include several such statements that together accumulate 20 signatures from lawmakers.

2. 10 or more Democratic Senators demand that Biden withdraw at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, as reported by the New York Times.

If both criteria are fulfilled, the answer will be YES. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

not_P.title: Will the USA win no more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins no more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the USA to achieve a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the United States Olympic Team secures a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

not_P.title: Will USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if no team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Count at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the United States Olympic Team is the sole highest-ranked team at the 2024 Paris Games. It will be deemed uncertain if the Paris Games do not occur before 2027. It will be answered negatively if any other team achieves a higher or equal ranking compared to the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals and also top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table that orders by number of Gold Medals, then Silver, then Bronze. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves negatively if either condition (a) or (b) is not met.

not_P.title: Will the USA win no more Gold than Silver medals or will it not top the Olympic Medal Table at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is not the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the medal table that orders by number of Gold Medals, then Silver, then Bronze. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves negatively if both condition (a) and (b) are met.

para_P.title: Will the United States secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals and also lead the Olympic Medal Table during the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher count of Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (b) The United States Olympic Team is the sole highest positioned team in the 2024 Paris Olympics, according to the medal table ranked first by Gold Medals, followed by Silver, and then Bronze. The question will be deemed ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027. It will be considered a No if either condition (a) or (b) is not fulfilled.

question.body:

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news that they believe Biden's chances for a November victory are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to consider terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could happen through a signed letter as mentioned earlier, but it might also occur through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is necessary for all five individuals to be part of a unified group communication. If five people express their individual opinions to reporters about Biden needing to step down, it will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Any reports regarding an unspecified number of Democrats writing to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill the conditions of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases of ambiguity where names are reported but not verified beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This can be through signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed Democrats must have at least 5 qualifying names made public before the deadline. Ambiguities will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this condition resolves NO.

The combined question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This means that either no such group will form, or if they do, they will not meet the criteria of working together in a sufficient manner. Reports of unnamed Democrats must not have at least 5 qualifying names made public before the deadline. Ambiguities will err towards resolving YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this condition resolves YES.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a statement is made before the deadline, this condition resolves YES.

The combined question resolves YES only if neither (a) nor (b) occurs as specified.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) A collective of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) A coalition of at least five specific Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators must collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This can be accomplished through methods such as signing a letter or a group engaging with Biden directly. All five individuals must communicate as part of the same group message. Five individuals independently expressing to journalists that they believe Biden should step aside is inadequate. Reports regarding unnamed Democrats must include at least five qualifying names made public before the cutoff. Any uncertainties will default to resolving NO. If these stipulations are not fulfilled before July 20th, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will neither pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made prior to the deadline, this condition resolves NO.

The overall question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as outlined.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the primary web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution remains positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Will Russia possess authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the subsequent classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the site is not categorized as being under Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other classifications created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or the absence of Russian control over the area.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and definitive. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(a) Will Russia have no control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under none of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

para_P.body:
