question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there not be another Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party on the horizon?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 (b) There is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 (b) There is no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to no. Otherwise, it will resolve to yes.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20 and (b) there is another debate among Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
(a) Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators indicating this before midnight July 20 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

(b) This will resolve to YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will resolve to NO in other cases.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will the likelihood of Kamala winning rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed YES if the Electoral College chance for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be considered NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 going to be a Woman?
para_P.body:
This will conclude with a “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

It will conclude with a “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a man as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, and (b) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, or (b) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Nate Silver's model shows an increase in Kamala's chances of winning over the next week, and (b) the Democratic Party will nominate a woman for the 2024 Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if the probability for Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be considered FALSE otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This will be confirmed as “yes” when a female presidential nominee is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the 2024 election. It will be confirmed as “no” when a male presidential nominee is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Ireland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Luxembourg not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Luxembourg does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Does Luxembourg make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Luxembourg competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. For any other results, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will both Ireland and Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occur: (a) Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Luxembourg does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Ireland and Luxembourg set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Luxembourg takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th.

If not, it will be considered a NO.

question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is a Woman Going to be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024?
para_P.body:
This will conclude with a “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

This will conclude with a “no” if the Democratic delegates opt for a male candidate as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following occur: (1) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (2) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. If either or both of these conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if at least one of the following occurs: (1) There is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (2) The Democratic delegates do not select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. If both of these conditions are met, the question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday and that a woman is chosen as the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the subsequent events take place: (1) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (2) A female candidate is selected by the Democratic delegates for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election. If either or both of these criteria are not satisfied, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

not_P.title: Will Taylor Swift not cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if she does not appear in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Taylor Swift will make a guest appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine?
para_P.body: This will resolve to YES if she is present in the film in any capacity, including just her voice being utilized for a character. It will still resolve to YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided that independent sources confirm her appearance.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

not_P.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine NOT have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
not_P.body:
Analysts are projecting that the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie will not have a huge opening weekend.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn less than $340 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mean it will not mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with less than $160 million, making it not the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie NOT top these marks? It will probably not be close...

It will certainly play at fewer theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses less than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as NOT the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

para_P.title: Will the Deadpool and Wolverine film achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film? [surpassing Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting an enormous opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The movie, helmed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to earn between $340 million and $360 million worldwide in its debut weekend. This would establish a new record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is projected to open with $160 million to $170 million, making it the highest R-rated debut of all time.

"""

[image]The current record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will this new release surpass those figures? It’s likely to be very close...

It will undoubtedly be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was a phenomenal success at the time, and it took many by surprise.

Since BoxOfficeMojo has a peculiar way of reporting international opening weekends -- it presents the raw figures but aggregates them oddly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to provide confirmation of the weekend's opening numbers.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated film release

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be considered unofficial until there is validation in the Hollywood media. The target number we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift will cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

(b) Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The record to beat is the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift will not cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine nor (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will not have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift does not appear in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

(b) Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" does not gross more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The record to beat is the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Taylor Swift will make a guest appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine and (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if Taylor Swift is featured in the film "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any capacity, including just using her voice for a character. It will still be deemed TRUE even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided that independent sources confirm her involvement. 

(b) This will be deemed TRUE if "Deadpool x Wolverine" earns over $284.5M worldwide during its opening weekend according to reports AND if the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) states that it sets the record for an R-rated film release. The benchmark to surpass is the original Deadpool's $284.5M globally.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault linked to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

not_P.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council not include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name going to be part of the Guardian Council's approved candidates for the presidency in Iran?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the list of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election as determined by Iran's Guardian Council.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, or will Iran's Guardian Council not include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is not included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and will Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name appear on the Guardian Council's approved candidate list for Iran's presidency?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) After this question is published and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory, resulting in the deaths of at least five people. (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the approved candidates for the presidential election by Iran's Guardian Council.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, remain with the Republican Party in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. Should no election take place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, with the announcement being definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, and (b) a person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, as reported by credible sources, or if popular sources disagree, as confirmed by an Ohio State source or statement, with the election held before January 1, 2025. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, or will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?

If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and will the Republican Party maintain control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?

If the election does not take place before January 1, 2025, the question is rendered void.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Will Rishi Sunak be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Rishi Sunak will not be elected in the upcoming 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament representing any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the resolution will be **No**.

The resolution should reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Rishi Sunak will fail to be elected if he is not elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election, for any reason. Credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate will be used for resolution.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) Rishi Sunak is elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy will not be the Republican nominee if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Rishi Sunak will be elected if he is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election, for any reason. Credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate will be used for resolution.

para_P.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than by who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Rishi Sunak will not win a seat if he is not elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. Reliable media reports or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting will be used to determine the outcome.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be considered a yes. If not, it will be a no.

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 (b) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met. 
(b) Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20 (b) Hurd will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) If Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met. 
(b) Hurd must not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20 (b) Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The first condition is satisfied if Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. 
(b) Hurd must be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The nominee is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if credible sources indicate that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to actively urge him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter similar to what has been mentioned, or it could take the form of a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective communication. If five individuals independently inform reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be sufficient for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request that he step down will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before this market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The European Union does not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, nor (b) A group of fewer than 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators do not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by not signing a letter or another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. If five individuals separately tell reporters they think Biden should drop out, that would still not be sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) The European Union issues new tariffs or taxes on the import of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (b) A coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators pressurize Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reputable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared that new tariffs or taxes will be enforced on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if a coalition of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to urge Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively asking him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters their belief that Biden should drop out will not suffice for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's standards unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before this market's cutoff date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with reasonable certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are not eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winner of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if any other team takes the title after the Knicks are no longer in the running.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Miami Heat not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if the Miami Heat is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is not eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the Miami Heat emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if another team is declared the champion or if the Miami Heat is removed from the competition.

question.title: Will both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat are crowned champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). Since only one team can be crowned champion, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither the New York Knicks nor the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if neither the New York Knicks nor the Miami Heat are crowned champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). Since only one team can be crowned champion, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Can the 2024 NBA Finals be won by both the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** only if the New York Knicks and the Miami Heat both receive the title of champions in the 2024 NBA Finals, as stated by [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). Given that there can only be one champion, the outcome of this question will be **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be considered FALSE if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a TRUE resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then later removed, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion columns, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) Resolves YES if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Resolves NO if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President until then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) Resolves YES if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Resolves NO if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then subsequently removed, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Biden continues to serve as President until the end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his VP as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President as defined by the Constitution).

(b) Resolves YES if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements are insufficient for resolution. Resolves NO if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 electoral cycle.

If such an unequivocal statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would consider accepting the nomination.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Lithuania fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Greece and Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Greece and Lithuania qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Greece and Lithuania both set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania fails to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.body:
