This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. A “No” outcome will occur if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher chance of winning than Joe Biden according to the same FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referring to the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is available. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is released. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) FiveThirtyEight project Joe Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris announce her VP pick as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight will project Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. Changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not affect the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

(b) Kamala Harris will announce her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will be based on Kamala Harris's own confirmation of her VP pick. If she announces anyone else, this will resolve as NO.

not_P.body:

This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this will resolve 50-50. Changes in methodology by FiveThirtyEight will not affect the resolution. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

(b) Kamala Harris will not announce her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The resolution will be based on Kamala Harris's own confirmation of her VP pick. If she announces anyone else, this will resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) FiveThirtyEight will indicate Joe Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris will declare her choice for VP as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
para_P.body:
(a) FiveThirtyEight is expected to show Joe Biden as having a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to their election forecast for July 19, 2024. This will be assessed based on the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast page. If Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, this will be considered a 50-50 outcome. Any changes in FiveThirtyEight's methodology will not influence this determination. Should there be no data points available for July 19 by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, the closest earlier data will be utilized.

(b) Kamala Harris is expected to reveal her selection for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th. The resolution will depend on Kamala Harris’s own announcement of her VP choice. If she names anyone else, this will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If she is selected, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official statement from an Ohio State source will be considered. If the election does not occur prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part resolves as **No**.

2. One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part resolves as **No**.

2. None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

At least one of these conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

not_P.body:

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially appointed as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will end with a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to still be President at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still the President of the United States by the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it will be deemed a NO if he either resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being the President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is President or Acting President of the US before July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) This question resolves to "Yes" if Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves to "No" if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a "Yes" resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris is President or Acting President of the US before July 26, 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is not formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) This question resolves to "Yes" if Joe Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves to "No" if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment, making his VP the Acting President, does not cause a "Yes" resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Kamala Harris holds the position of President or Acting President of the United States prior to July 26, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden continues as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as either President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, along with a consensus from reliable news reporting.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if Joe Biden remains in the role of US President until the end of July 2024 (ET). It will be answered with "No" if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary power shift under the 25th Amendment, where his Vice President becomes Acting President, will not result in a "Yes" answer, as Acting President is constitutionally distinct from President.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if a different individual is chosen for the VP position, this market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can determine its outcome right after the nomination.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President (VP). If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this condition will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this condition.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or will Kamala Harris not be nominated as the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occur:

(a) After 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden could accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic Vice President (VP). If someone else is selected as VP, this condition will resolve to yes. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this condition.

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden declare that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination, and will Kamala Harris be chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern time on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate (VP). If Kamala Harris is indeed nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition will be considered fulfilled. If another individual is chosen as VP, this condition will be regarded as unfulfilled. Changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this condition.

If either of the conditions (a) or (b) is not satisfied, this question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Czechia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In all other scenarios, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Czechia and Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Georgia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Czechia or Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Czechia and Georgia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Czechia and Georgia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the following conditions are met: (a) Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Georgia fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France secure a position in the Top 5 during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude positively if France secures a spot in the top 5 (ties are considered positive outcomes) at the Olympic Games occurring in 2024. It will conclude ambiguously if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by totaling the number of medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties for Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties for Silver) Total Bronze Medals

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple, based on Companies Market Cap, as verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators will persuade Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are numerous drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through a signed letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. Simply having five individuals express their opinion to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to ask him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed with certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and with **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied in seat count, both will be deemed **Yes**.

The resolution of this question is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading party in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA political groups hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning they are tied for the most seats. It will resolve as **No** if either group does not hold the most seats or if they do not tie for the most seats.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither GUE/NGL nor Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither the GUE/NGL nor Greens–EFA political groups hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning they are not tied for the most seats. It will resolve as **No** if either group does hold the most seats or if they do tie for the most seats.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA political groups secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both the GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA political factions secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, indicating they are equal in seat count. It will result in a **No** if either faction fails to secure the highest number of seats or if they do not achieve a tie for the most seats.

The outcome of this inquiry will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he secure a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll presents Manifold respondents with a hypothetical ballot featuring Joe Biden, while the other offers a generic Democrat. 

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in hypothetical scenarios are either leading or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents indicative of the broader public? 

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump’s vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more at the polls' closure. 

To calculate Trump’s vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the result is NO. 

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated close time, regardless of circumstances.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat (b) USD reaches a value of at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) There are two polls conducted by Manifold, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically leads or is within the margin of error. Are the opinions of Manifold respondents indicative of the broader population?

This market will be resolved as YES if the share of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). The answer is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

(b) The market will resolve based on the USD/JPY closing rate reported for August 9th, 2024, on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Australia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Australia set to reach the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Australia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Australia fails to qualify, the outcome will be recorded as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If Latvia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Australia and Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Australia or Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Australia or Latvia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final but is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final but is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Australia and Latvia qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are both Australia and Latvia set to advance to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Australia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Australia or Latvia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to other candidates being introduced in the future, not just those currently listed.

For this question, the identity of the individual who gains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(2) This question will resolve as Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be answered with Yes if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4. A positive number indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead.

(2) This inquiry will be answered with Yes if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he remains in the race, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or someone else entirely (NO)?
para_P.body:
Currently, the top contenders for Kamala’s vice-presidential candidate are Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports indicate that Kamala will make her selection before August 7th.

This market will resolve to YES if and when Kamala Harris reveals her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

The market will resolve to NO if Kamala Harris announces a different individual as her running mate.

Feel free to comment if you have any questions or updates 💙

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Kamala Harris picks either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
question.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

(b) This resolves to YES if Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. It resolves to NO if she announces anyone else as her running mate.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 nor (b) Kamala Harris picks either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP?
not_P.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

(b) This resolves to YES if Kamala Harris does not announce her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. It resolves to NO if she announces either of them as her running mate.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) Biden exits the race prior to July 20 and (b) Kamala Harris selects either Kelly or Shapiro as her vice presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) This is considered YES if Biden exits or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. If not, it is considered NO.

(b) This is considered YES if Kamala Harris declares her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, with confirmation from Kamala herself. It is considered NO if she chooses someone else as her running mate.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden withdraw, will a credible news source report the event at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news outlets, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be deemed adequate.

This market will be classified as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate and (b) Joe Biden's dropout covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate nor (b) Joe Biden's dropout covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Question resolves YES if no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) another presidential debate among Democratic candidates and (b) the media reliably reporting Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if there is a debate featuring potential Democratic candidates (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be NO in any other case.

(b) This question will be YES if a major and trustworthy media source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he makes an official announcement of his dropout through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be classified as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

If such an agreement is announced, this condition is **Yes**. (2) The party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If this condition is not met, this condition is **No**. If neither condition is met, the question resolves as **Yes**; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) will establish a political coalition with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative elections; (b) The Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question is answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) An electoral partnership or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is officially declared by June 30, 2024, according to reliable sources. If such an agreement is not announced, this criterion is **No**. (2) The political party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on credible sources. If both criteria are fulfilled, the question is resolved as **Yes**; otherwise, it is resolved as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he secure at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to vote alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public sentiment frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically is either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the general populace?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls finish. 

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the first poll's formula and the second poll's formula is at least 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump give testimony in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if Trump's votes in poll 1 exceed poll 2 by 3% or more, based on the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). Otherwise, NO.

(b) This resolves YES if credible sources report Trump has testified, in person or remotely, at the trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump does not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if Trump's votes in poll 1 do not exceed poll 2 by 3% or more, based on the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). Otherwise, NO.

(b) This resolves YES if there are no credible sources reporting that Trump has testified, in person or remotely, at the trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump increases his support by at least 3% among Manifold survey participants when compared to Biden versus a generic Democrat, (b) Trump provides testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) Two polls from Manifold will conclude on July 6, one featuring Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat. This will be considered TRUE if Trump's percentage in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll, calculated using the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If not, it will be FALSE.

(b) This will be deemed TRUE if reliable sources indicate that Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the Netherlands qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If the Netherlands does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Netherlands competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If the Netherlands fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Croatia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having moved on to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will both the Netherlands and Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) The Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.body:

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.
