question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote in favor of Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation deal or the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
para_P.body: The question will be resolved as **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly recommending that Tesla investors vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the board of directors at Tesla. If this does not occur, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (b) Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body: (a) The market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time) for this part to resolve YES. (b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) must release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors for this part to resolve YES. The combined question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve YES.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (b) Will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
not_P.body: (a) The market embedded in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) must not have 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time) for this part to resolve YES. (b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) must not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors for this part to resolve YES. The combined question resolves YES if at least one of (a) or (b) resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Will the market linked in the provided URL have a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15? (b) Will ISS recommend that Tesla shareholders oppose either Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: (a) The market referenced in the link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) needs to have at least 377 traders by market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time) for this component to be considered a YES. (b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) must issue a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's compensation package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or Kimbal Musk's re-election to the Tesla board for this component to be considered a YES. The overall question will be a YES only if both (a) and (b) are answered YES.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. does not apply. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be considered a NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, nor (b) Joe Biden dies before July 26th, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen: (a) before August 2024, Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, and (b) Joe Biden passes away prior to July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) utilize Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency through death, resignation, etc. does not apply. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

(b) Resolves YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies a Biden lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) see an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined by the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must not be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) on July 15, 2024, Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 3 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the value recorded is Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This question will be determined based on data from the St. Louis Fed available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024, must exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Democrats to hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is needed, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **No** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **Yes**.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to no. Otherwise, it will resolve to yes.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024: This question will be answered as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will be answered as **No**.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If it becomes evident before midnight July 20 Central Time that there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is less than 24.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 24 global records be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This question is answered as **Yes** if the total number of global records surpassed during the Paris Olympic Games is 24 or more.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France secure a position in the Top 5 during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if France secures a spot in the top 5 (ties will be considered affirmative) at the Olympic Games scheduled for 2024. It will be considered uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by summing the total medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken and (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body:
(a) At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving as **Yes** if the count is 24 or greater.

(b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving positively if France is in the top 5 (ties included) based on the medal count calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. Number of Silver Medals (if Gold is tied)
3. Number of Bronze Medals (if Silver is tied).

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken or (b) France does not place in the Top 5?
not_P.body:
(a) At least 24 world records are not broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving as **Yes** if the count is less than 24.

(b) France does not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving negatively if France is not in the top 5 (ties included) based on the medal count calculated by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. Number of Silver Medals (if Gold is tied)
3. Number of Bronze Medals (if Silver is tied).

The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following happen at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A minimum of 24 world records are set and (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 24 world records are set during the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving as **Yes** if the total is 24 or more.

(b) France finishes in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, resolving positively if France is among the top 5 (including ties) based on the medal count calculated by:
1. Total Number of Gold Medals
2. Total Number of Silver Medals (if Gold is tied)
3. Total Number of Bronze Medals (if Silver is tied).

The question remains unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will be considered a Yes if Team USA achieves victory in both events. It will be a No if either the men's or women's team finishes in a position other than first place.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Philadelphia 76ers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will be answered with **No** if any other team wins, as they would then be out of the running.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and (b) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and (2) the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves No if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will either of the following not occur: (a) The United States does not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or (b) The Philadelphia 76ers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following conditions are not met: (1) Team USA does not win gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or (2) the Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves No if both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Will both events take place: (a) The United States secures gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and (b) The Philadelphia 76ers emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with Yes if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Team USA achieves gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and (2) the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as recognized by the NBA. It is answered with No if either or both of these criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is ratified through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is true:

- OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must not indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it must be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has not accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must not be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI make a public pledge to uphold the principle of "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI makes a public pledge to uphold the "no retaliation for disclosing public risks" principle through a declaration from the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This declaration can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a comment during an interview). The statement from OpenAI must reflect a new commitment to this principle compared to the timeframe when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism." 
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must meet at least the standard of "this was a positive initial step" for this question to be answered as **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (2) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this condition to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) The Pandemic Agreement is not approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (2) OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Additionally, Metaculus verifies that the company has not accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of dissatisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be less rigorous than "this was a good first step" for this condition to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of these events will take place: (1) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024 (2) OpenAI makes a public pledge to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. The Pandemic Agreement is ratified in a vote at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as confirmed by reliable sources.

2. OpenAI makes a public declaration regarding the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, through a statement from the organization or a spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. This declaration can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote in an interview). The announcement from OpenAI must reflect a heightened commitment to the principle compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply reiterate that, for instance, "we already have a culture of open criticism." Furthermore, Metaculus must confirm that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to certain signatories or supporters to evaluate their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this condition to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this happens, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the US government terminate its agreement that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative registry for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or cancels its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's oversight of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of rejecting the nomination. If such a statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will the US government continue its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this happens, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government concludes its contract with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility of accepting the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this will be considered No.

(b) Will the US government terminate its agreement that allows Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, prior to August 3, 2024? This will be Yes if the US Department of Commerce officially ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign concerning the management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, this will be No.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they fail to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will determine whether Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

(b) One of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

(b) None of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 3 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) a Trump family member will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if the following two conditions are satisfied:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race exceeds 2 and does not go beyond 3 points. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, a measurement of 2.4 implies that Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points.

(b) One of the following persons must be the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.body: This market will conclude with a YES if NVDA ends any day before July 31 priced under $100.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to the figure from June 2024.

The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) ends trading below $100 per share by July 31, and (b) the US Core CPI on a Month-over-Month basis rises by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body: (a) This market will resolve to YES if NVDA trades under $100 on any day prior to July 31. question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.body:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

para_P.title: Will Russia take control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of the subsequent classifications:

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will face removal or obstruction from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or obstructed from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or obstruction must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place *after* the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state’s primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or obstructed from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or obstructed from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently being discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unspecified Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls conducted by Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other allows them to vote with a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error threshold, whereas every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically either leads or is within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. Otherwise, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the specified closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the election.

(b) There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Joe Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference in percentages between the two polls is >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the election.

(b) There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Joe Biden poll does not exceed that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference in percentages between the two polls is < 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) When matched against Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump receives at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is chosen as the nominee by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on election day.

(b) There are two Manifold polls that conclude on July 6. One poll asks voters to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for a vote with a generic Democrat. This question is resolved as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Joe Biden poll is at least 3% higher than in the generic Democrat poll when both polls close. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the percentage difference between the two polls is >= 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden not be greater than 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 in the national polling average by 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election OR will Trump's lead over Biden be 3 or less or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is 3 or less or greater than 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election AND will Donald Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is made solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

not_P.title: Will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is the head of the Secret Service expected to step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is it anticipated that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will leave her position, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday or will the head of the Secret Service not resign within the next 90 days?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if either of the following does not occur: (a) there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, does not resign, is not fired, or for any other reason is still the director of the Secret Service after October 12, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday and that the head of the Secret Service will step down within the next 90 days?
para_P.body: This will resolve to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is dismissed, or for any reason is no longer in her position as director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If these conditions are not fulfilled, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.
