para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement stating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

More details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Please contact @jskf for requests for early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there not be another Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party going to take place?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (a) and (b) resolve as Yes.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce he will accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or will there be no another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would decline the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be no another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This resolves as Yes if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if either (a) resolves as Yes or (b) resolves as Yes.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination prior to July 15, 2024, and will there be an additional Democratic presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden might accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this will be answered as No.

(b) Will there be an additional Democratic presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This is answered with Yes if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be answered as No otherwise.

The overall question will be answered as Yes if both (a) and (b) are answered as Yes.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* group evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially different (not entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

In this context, "accessible to the public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the scenario in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (for instance, minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be counted as a positive outcome if the service name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's offering remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. If unavailable in certain EU countries or to minors, it resolves positively if >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website changes.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, nor (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do *not* publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is *not* generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. If unavailable in certain EU countries or to minors, it resolves positively if ≤50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially different even if the name or website changes.

para_P.title: Is it expected that both of the following will take place by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind releases a report detailing the outcomes of an external evaluation of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this is answered with **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report with findings from an *external* organization assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this is answered with **YES** if ChatGPT is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, potentially requiring payment. If it is not available in specific EU countries or to minors, it resolves positively if over 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general online interface for engaging with GPT models, resolving positively if the service remains largely the same even if the name or website changes.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders face arrest warrants from the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below prior to July 1, 2024. It will be considered **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The response will be No if this does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). (2) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are not met.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, nor (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). (2) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) the ICC releases arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist incident occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) Prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following members of the Israeli cabinet: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). (2) A terrorist incident in Metropolitan France causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, aside from the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The incident must be characterized as a 'terrorist attack' by any French governmental agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The inquiry will be answered with No if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 according to the 538 national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Orlando Magic not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are crowned champions.

para_P.title: Will the Orlando Magic emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will result in a **No** for any other teams as they will be out of the running.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?

not_P.title: Will neither the Orlando Magic nor the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?

para_P.title: Can the Orlando Magic and the New York Knicks both emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to advance, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if it fails to qualify, the conclusion will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Malta and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Malta and Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Malta nor Slovenia participate in a Semi-final or are not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta and Slovenia both set to advance to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both Malta and Slovenia take part in a Semi-final and are subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. The answer will be **No** if either or both of them do not qualify.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as not the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 designate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. Should Biden and Trump have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in how FiveThirtyEight computes its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market will not resolve until the data for July 20 is available. If no data for July 19 is present by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will settle based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tim Scott is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will use the nearest previous figures to July 19.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Tim Scott is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or (b) FiveThirtyEight does not project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the resolution will use the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Tim Scott becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) FiveThirtyEight indicates Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Tim Scott is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. This is determined by the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for that specific date on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump have the same probability, the outcome is considered 50-50. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding figures to July 19 will be used for resolution.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure denotes a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA political group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group possesses the highest seat count after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie in seat count between two groups, both related sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy news sources.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be **No** for any other political factions. In the event of a tie in the number of seats between two groups, both will be regarded as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reputable media sources.

question.title: Will both Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both the Greens–EFA political group and the GUE/NGL political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If both groups are tied for the most seats, this question will resolve as **Yes**. If either group does not hold the most seats, this question will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither Greens–EFA nor GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither the Greens–EFA political group nor the GUE/NGL political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If both groups are tied for the most seats, this question will resolve as **No**. If either group holds the most seats, this question will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL parties secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both the Greens–EFA political faction and the GUE/NGL political faction secure the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament. If both factions are tied for the highest number of seats, this inquiry will also conclude as **Yes**. Conversely, if either faction fails to secure the highest number of seats, this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

This inquiry resolves based on [official declarations by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money trial?

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will no athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This question is answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing fewer than eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. at least one team playing the final of the last event has won one of the others).

para_P.title: Could a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **No** if women's squads from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the following eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- soccer 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the question to be answered as **Yes**.

The resolution of the question can occur as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will take place (for instance, if neither team competing in the final of the last event has won any of the other events).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. 

(b) This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 
- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.
Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. 

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 
- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.
Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will not happen (e.g. at least one team playing the final of the last event has won one of the others).

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) A tennis player secures more than one medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) The same country achieves victories in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if any tennis player earns at least two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics. 

(b) This inquiry will be answered as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) each claim gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 
- soccer 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.
Otherwise, the same NOC must have secured at least two of these events, leading to a **Yes** resolution for the question.

The question can be resolved as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for example, neither team competing in the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average by 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:

(a) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than who is announced as the nominee on election day.

(b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and it will be **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be marked as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (2) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024. This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump have a lead over Biden that exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 in 538's national polling average, and will the Greens–EFA party secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 3. This determination is based on the figure shown on the chart for that date, as viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

2. The Greens–EFA political faction possesses the largest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be confirmed through official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable news sources.

para_P.title: Are Tucker Carlson and Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidates for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will Biden withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: If Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump have a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, AND will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than 2 points or greater than 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, OR will Tim Scott not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) Tim Scott is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the national polling average from 538 show that Trump's advantage over Biden is between 2 and 3 points, and will Tim Scott be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

(a) The national polling average from 538 for the 2024 presidential election indicates that Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden is more than 2 points and at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reflected in the data accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure denotes a lead for Trump.

(b) Tim Scott is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), independent of who is declared the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains and the National Rally collaborate politically for the 2024 legislative elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, there is an official declaration of an electoral coalition or alliance between Les Républicains and the National Rally for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), as reported by [reputable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). Conversely, if no such coalition is announced, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France not belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Prime Minister of France a member of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable information.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, and (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (2) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, nor (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (1) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (2) The party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If both conditions are met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) collaborates with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, and (b) The Prime Minister of France is a member of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) An official announcement of an electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made before June 30, 2024, based on reliable sources. (2) The Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to trustworthy sources. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, the answer to this question will be **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This would be answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the declaration must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. not_P.body: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count.
