(2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (1) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (2) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body: (1) Biden is declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024: This will resolve as YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. (2) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President: This question will be answered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, this question will result in a **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If both conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met: (1) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If at least one condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following to happen: (a) Francis Suarez to be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) the Democrats to hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than the nominee declared on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) The Democratic Party needs to go through more than one voting round in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If either of these criteria is not fulfilled, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the answer to be **Yes**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a Woman (b) The same nation will win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It will resolve “no” if/when they select a male nominee.

(b) The question about the 2024 Olympics will resolve as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it will resolve as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

(b) The question about the 2024 Olympics will resolve as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it will resolve as Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 (b) The same country will achieve victory in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) The inquiry regarding the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024 will be answered with “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential candidate for the 2024 election. It will be answered with “no” if they opt for a male candidate.

(b) The question concerning the 2024 Olympics will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) secure gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, it will be answered with Yes if the same NOC wins at least two of these competitions.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be straightforward and definitive: it should eliminate any chance that Biden could agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be marked as **No**.

(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek or will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be ambiguous or inconclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) an increase in Kamala's chances of winning in the upcoming week according to Nate Silver's model and (b) Joe Biden's announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear announcement is not made by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend's attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are profoundly concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose by sheer force, create unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves YES.

(b) This question resolves as **No** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the plan to nominate Biden early, and (b) the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Background from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination ahead of schedule, which they contend suppresses the vital ongoing discourse regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO signals the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many within their ranks are quite troubled about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and perhaps, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether a letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that conclude on July 6. One poll inquires how Manifold participants would vote if Joe Biden were on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks how they would vote with a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios is either leading or within the margin of error. Are the responses from Manifold participants indicative of the broader public sentiment?

This market will be deemed YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Others)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the results of the first poll and the second poll meets or exceeds 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until they close, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) triggers Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Biden 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior likelihood of winning over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have identical probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for this resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight derives its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is available. It is possible that this market does not resolve until the data for July 20 is released. If there are no data points for July 19 available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the chances of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will NOT be taken into account.

question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. not_P.body: Resolves YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 AND will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. (b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden must have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. If their probabilities are equal, this market will resolve as 50-50. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values shown by the blue and red trend lines for the market's resolution date. Any changes in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight uses to calculate its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. This market will resolve based on the data points for July 19 as soon as data points for July 20 are available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to remain president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump over the weekend that many of their members are still quite troubled about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate him early?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (2) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to meet the second condition. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not be president by the end of July 2024, or will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate him early?
not_P.body: This question resolves YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is not officially president of the United States. (2) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. If both conditions are met, this question also resolves YES.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in the presidential position, and will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate him early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden continues to hold the title of President of the United States. (2) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st, 2024, at least 20 Democratic House Representatives or Senators have signed a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative. It is also acceptable if there are multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers to fulfill the second criterion. If either of these conditions fails to be met, the response to this question will be negative.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democrats need multiple rounds of voting during their roll call ballot to officially select their nominee for the 2024 presidential election in the United States. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, the answer will be **No**.

question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 nor (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) A minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members endorse a public statement against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats experience a brokered convention in 2024: This happens if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this does not happen.

(b) A minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members endorse a public statement against the early nomination plan for Biden: This occurs if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such statements with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this does not happen.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on election day in 2024; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Iran military response not before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran launch a military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Iran conducts a military operation within Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas from July 30 to August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such action occurs, the market will conclude with a "No". 

For the purposes of this market, a "military operation" refers to any forceful engagement by Iran within Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons storage facility in Israel, this would lead to a "Yes" resolution) that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground assaults. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered in the resolution of this market.

Only military actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian land, will be included in the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, and (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, nor (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if there are no credible sources reporting that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is not officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces not explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or not confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial, and (b) Iran launches a military operation on Israeli land before August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This market will determine a "Yes" resolution if Iran starts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, by 11:59 PM ET. In this context, a "military operation" is defined as any act of force carried out by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered for the resolution of this market. Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory will be counted towards the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy groups will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden's polling numbers be more than 2 but at most 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democratic Party will need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party must conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is sufficient, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves as **No** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) the Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

not_P.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be less than or equal to 75k or greater than 77k?
not_P.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the final value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but remain at or below 77,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry is determined by the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question may take into account any new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).
