not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.
(b) This question will resolve as **No** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX exceed 75,000 but not surpass 77,000, and will Donald Trump be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry resolves based on the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.
(b) This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This inquiry may take into account new candidates introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed more likely to win the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, this market will resolve with a 50-50 outcome.

The resolution will rely on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the values shown by the blue and red trend lines on the specified date for resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is made available. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is accessible. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve according to the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a figure out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538, specifically on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. It will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same source for the same date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The relevant data is the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and changes in methodology will not affect the resolution. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. The odds are reported as a number out of 100 to the 1 digit mark. (b) This question will resolve based on whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
not_P.body: (a) This question will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. It will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning than Donald Trump according to the same source for the same date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The relevant data is the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and changes in methodology will not affect the resolution. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. The odds are reported as a number out of 100 to the 1 digit mark. (b) This question will resolve based on whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) FiveThirtyEight forecasts Joe Biden as the frontrunner against Donald Trump on July 19, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is more than 2 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher chance of winning than Joe Biden from the same source for that date. If their probabilities are identical, the resolution will be 50-50. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The pertinent data will be represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and any changes in methodology will not influence the resolution. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, the closest prior figures to July 19 will be utilized. The probabilities are expressed as a number out of 100 to one decimal place. (b) This inquiry will be resolved based on whether Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be considered **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied for seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, nor (b) the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be considered **No** for any other political factions. In the event of a tie between two factions for seats, both parts of the question will be resolved as **Yes**. The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media reports.

(b) This inquiry will be marked **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned by a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

If at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is confirmed that 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to step down, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Luxembourg not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Luxembourg does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Luxembourg going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Luxembourg takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In all other scenarios, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if it fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Luxembourg and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Luxembourg and Slovenia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Luxembourg nor Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Luxembourg nor Slovenia participate in their respective Semi-finals or are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Luxembourg and Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both Luxembourg and Slovenia take part in their individual Semi-finals and are officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. The outcome will be **No** if either or both fail to qualify.

question.title: Will Norway qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Norway does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Norway set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Norway takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Norway fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Switzerland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Switzerland set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Switzerland competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Switzerland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Norway and Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Norway and Switzerland participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will either Norway or Switzerland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Norway or Switzerland does not participate in their respective Semi-finals or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If both Norway and Switzerland qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Norway and Switzerland set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if both Norway and Switzerland take part in their designated Semi-finals and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares them as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Norway or Switzerland fails to qualify, the outcome will be a **No**.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both Elon Musk appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and Donald Trump be removed from any U.S. state primary ballot for a federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024; (2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will either Elon Musk not appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump not be removed from any U.S. state primary ballot for a federal office under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following conditions is not met: (1) Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024; (2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will both Elon Musk participate in the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event and Donald Trump be disqualified from any U.S. state primary ballot for a federal position due to the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Elon Musk is featured as a speaker on the main stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the premier Bitcoin gatherings, occurring from July 25-27, 2024; (2) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally excluded or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy news sources. If either of these conditions is not fulfilled, the inquiry will be marked as NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to select a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently reveal that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in a hypothetical scenario either leads or is within the error margin. Are the Manifold respondents reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the difference between the percentage from poll 1 and poll 2 is equal to or exceeds 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will five or more identified Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already publicly suggested that Biden step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local news sources that they believe Biden's chances for a November victory are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to reflect on ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might involve a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals convey a unified message. If five individuals independently inform reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are subsequently revealed before the market's closing date. In any unclear instances where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these stipulations are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat: 
There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: 
Politico reports multiple drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: 
Politico reports multiple drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) Trump will increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, and (2) A coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(1) Trump will increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat: 
There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on another hypothetical ballot. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are closed. The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) A coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th: 
Politico has reported several drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one urging Biden to cease his campaign. This resolves YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be done through signing a letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective message. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should step aside is not enough for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before this market's conclusion. In unclear situations, this market will tend to resolve NO. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Not Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Keep Its EU Majority from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest share of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, as per reliable sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Are new tariffs or duties on the import of Chinese electric vehicles expected to be announced by the European Union prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if credible sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 and (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources; and (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 nor (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources; and (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Are the following two events going to take place: (a) the Fidesz-KDNP alliance retains its status as the largest party from Hungary in the EU in 2024, and (b) the EU reveals new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if both of these criteria are fulfilled: (a) After the European Parliament elections in 2024, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus keeping the greatest number of Hungarian representatives in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources; and (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible reports indicate that the European Union (EU) has disclosed the implementation of new tariffs or duties that will be levied on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

not_P.title: Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
not_P.body: This will resolve YES if Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Will there be a new Moana attraction revealed by Disney for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will be marked YES if Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or prior to the D23 convention in August 2024. It will be marked NO if it is merely mentioned in a brainstorming context like some attractions were at the last D23. It will also be marked NO if a Moana attraction is announced for another theme park in Florida or in a different location. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the convention, and the outcome will be determined after the convention.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 AND will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if BOTH of the following occur:
(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. The announcement must be more than just discussing ideas, and must specifically be for the Magic Kingdom park, not any other park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. This part will be resolved after the convention.
(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The movie is expected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, which would make it the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million globally.

not_P.title: Will Disney not announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 OR will Deadpool & Wolverine not have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve YES if EITHER of the following occur:
(a) Disney does not announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. The announcement must be more than just discussing ideas, and must specifically be for the Magic Kingdom park, not any other park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. This part will be resolved after the convention.
(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grossing $284.5 million or less globally in its opening weekend according to reports, OR the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not confirm it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The movie is expected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, which would make it the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The current record is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million globally.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Disney will reveal a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024 AND that Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if BOTH of the following conditions are met:
(a) Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. The revelation must go beyond mere discussions of concepts and must specifically pertain to the Magic Kingdom park, excluding any other parks in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will close on August 8, the day preceding the convention. This aspect will be determined after the convention.
(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend as per reports, AND this figure is confirmed by the Hollywood Reporter (or a comparable publication) as the record for an R-rated movie release. The film is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, which would set a new record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. The current record is held by the original Deadpool, with $284.5 million globally.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he remains in the race, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Mike Pence is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Mike Pence going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be considered a **No**. This question is open to the addition of other candidates beyond those currently listed.

For the purposes of this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
(b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20, or (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.
(b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of these events happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, and (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20.
(b) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, no matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

not_P.title: Will Poland not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland competes in a Semi-final and the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) officially declares that Poland has qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If Poland fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.
