question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the political group with the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and with **No** for all other scenarios. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (possibly requiring payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" pertains to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The Greens–EFA political group must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. In case of a tie between groups, this resolves as **Yes**. Resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on that date, meaning the default state for EU residents is access without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. Availability issues in some EU countries or to certain demographics (e.g., minors) do not affect this, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface and resolves positively if the name or website changes, as long as the service remains substantially the same.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections nor (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) The Greens–EFA political group must not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. In case of a tie between groups, this resolves as **No**. Resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must not be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This resolves as **No** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on that date, meaning the default state for EU residents is access without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. Availability issues in some EU countries or to certain demographics (e.g., minors) do not affect this, as long as >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface and resolves negatively if the name or website changes, as long as the service remains substantially the same.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) the Greens–EFA group secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The Greens–EFA political faction must achieve the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This is determined as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the most seats, and as **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie among factions, this is resolved as **Yes**. The determination is based on official announcements from the European Parliament or reliable news sources.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT must be broadly available in the EU on June 30, 2024. This is classified as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally accessible in the EU on that date, which means that the standard access for EU residents is without a VPN, potentially requiring payment. Availability challenges in specific EU nations or for certain groups (such as minors) do not impact this, as long as over 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface and is considered positively if the name or website changes, provided that the service remains fundamentally unchanged.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would represent a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization not be larger than Apple's?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on June 28th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's on June 28, 2024, as reported by [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Nvidia's market capitalization will be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (2) Nvidia's market capitalization will be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is not greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 in 538's national polling average, and will Nvidia's market value surpass that of Apple's on June 28, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that exceeds 2 and is at most 3 in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, as observed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

2. On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, as per [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will resolve to **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports emerge showing that an attack ascribed to Israel has taken place within the territory of Iran and resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average; (b) Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average; (b) Israel will not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's margin over Biden will exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average; (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure signifies a Trump advantage, while a negative figure indicates that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This question will resolve **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources report that an attack attributed to Israel, taking place within Iran's territory, has resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

not_P.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of less than 75%? ("Not Certified Fresh")
not_P.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is less than 75%, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Not Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires <75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

para_P.title: Will the critics' score for "Twisters" (2024) on Rotten Tomatoes reach or exceed 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
para_P.body:
The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)

This will be considered YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or above, one week post-release (July 26th). 

Additional Information 

I will rely on the precision provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, without decimals).

For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) presently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the score I will refer to.

The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for reference only (as far as I know, it requires a score of >=75% on the Tomatometer, but there may be additional criteria—the market resolves solely based on the score shown).

"Twisters" (2024) acts as a standalone sequel to the original from 1996, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings from **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 plus $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) not have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% or will "Deadpool & Wolverine" not have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body:

"Twisters" (2024) will not have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% if the Tomatometer score is less than 75% one week after release (July 26th), as displayed on the "Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page. The score will be taken as an integer percentage, with no decimals. "Certified Fresh" is used for illustrative purposes, but the resolution is solely based on the displayed score. 2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" will not have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined if the domestic box office opening reported by Boxofficemojo is less than or equal to $185,548,391, which is the sum of the openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013).

para_P.title: Will the critics' score for "Twisters" (2024) reach at least 75% on Rotten Tomatoes, and will "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined domestic opening box office of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body:
1. The Rotten Tomatoes critics' score for "Twisters" (2024) will be at least 75% if the Tomatometer rating is 75% or above, one week after its release on July 26th, as shown on the Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024). This score will be considered as a whole number percentage, without any decimal points. The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for context, but the final determination is based solely on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) is directed by Lee Isaac Chung and features Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar Jones.

2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" will exceed the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined if the domestic box office opening reported by Boxofficemojo exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013).

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will be deemed **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently known; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who receives the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if no credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, remain under the control of the Republican Party in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if reliable sources indicate that a candidate affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where there is a conflict among popular sources, a statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. If no election takes place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Tucker Carlson must be the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). Credible sources must report this victory, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used to confirm the result. If no special election is held before January 1, 2025, this condition cannot be satisfied and the question is annulled.

If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is **Yes**. If either or both are not satisfied, the answer is **No**.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following not occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party does not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

1. Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Tucker Carlson must not be the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A person representing the Republican Party does not win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). Credible sources must not report this victory, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used to confirm the result. If no special election is held before January 1, 2025, this condition cannot be satisfied and the question is annulled.

If at least one condition is not satisfied, the answer is **Yes**. If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party secures Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This indicates that Tucker Carlson must be the individual selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A candidate representing the Republican Party emerges victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously occupied by Bill Johnson). Reliable sources must report this win, and in the event of conflicting reports among major sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be utilized to verify the outcome. If no special election occurs before January 1, 2025, this condition cannot be met, and the question will be rendered void.

If both criteria are met, the answer is **Yes**. If either or both are not met, the answer is **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as provided by 538 on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Vice President for the Democratic Party?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Vice President for the Democratic Party. Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP position, the market will conclude with a no. Any changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the outcome of this market. The resolution of the market can occur right after the nomination.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: 
(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will at least one of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following conditions is met: 
(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will both of these events take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Kamala Harris serve as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of these criteria are satisfied: 
(a) Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 2 and at most 4 in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.
(b) Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is selected for the role of Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If another individual is appointed as VP, this market will resolve to no. Any changes to the VP position after the initial selection will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e. appointing his VP as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate must be selected for this question to resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. The outcome is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not remain President through end of July 2024 nor (b) Ron DeSantis is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves YES if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as YES. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to take place: (a) Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024 and (b) Ron DeSantis becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden continues as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); this will resolve to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as NO. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant. It is determined solely by who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will be deemed YES if Biden engages in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, and similar events. It may include podcast appearances or late-night show interviews, or segments edited into shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage featuring Biden being interviewed in person. For example, a 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: (a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview, such as on a podcast or late night show, for at least 45 minutes of new footage, released before the end of July 2024. The interview should not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, nor (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: (a) Joe Biden must not appear in an in-person interview, such as on a podcast or late night show, for at least 45 minutes of new footage, released before the end of July 2024. The interview should not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must not be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but no more than 4 points on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) Joe Biden is required to participate in a face-to-face interview, such as on a podcast or a late-night show, providing at least 45 minutes of new footage that is released before July 2024 ends. This interview must exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump must have a lead over Joe Biden that is greater than 3 but less than or equal to 4 points according to the national polling average from 538, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates that Trump is ahead.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to publicly oppose their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Larry Elder not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will no athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple tennis medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry concludes with a **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will result in a "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for condition (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, condition (b) will be considered met immediately.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if not both of the following conditions are met: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for condition (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, condition (b) will not be considered met immediately.

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) a tennis player secures more than one medal, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve a total of 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) An athlete obtains at least two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together earn 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution for condition (b) will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, condition (b) will be deemed fulfilled immediately.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate must be selected as the nominee for this question to resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may be introduced later.

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

para_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the competitor who secures the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming competitions.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will a swimmer not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics or will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?

(b) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will a swimmer secure the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Games and will five or more nations achieve their first gold medal at these Olympics?
para_P.body: This question is answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The competitor who wins the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) At least 5 nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, contending that it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as per a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still profoundly concerned about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter’s existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple letters that collectively gather 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be sufficient for this market to resolve to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will not both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. If such a letter is signed by at least 20 lawmakers, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats do not have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule, and (b) there will be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule: This will be considered YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination plan is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple statements that together have a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements will also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, then this market resolves to NO.

(b) There will be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024: This will be considered YES if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one vote is necessary, then this question resolves to NO.
